meanings.definition: To subject to the action of smoke or fumes for the purpose of disinfection.
meanings.sent1: The old books were fumigated to remove any bugs or germs.
meanings.sent2: The pest control company fumigated the entire house to get rid of the insects.
meanings.sent3: The magician fumigated his hat, hoping to make the rabbits disappear!
meanings.sent4: The idea of starting fresh fumigated her mind, clearing out all negative thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the fumigated room lingered, reminding everyone of the thorough cleaning.

meanings.definition: To apply smoke or fumes to in order to disinfect or eradicate pests.
meanings.sent1: The farmers fumigated the crops to protect them from harmful insects.
meanings.sent2: The exterminator fumigated the entire building to eliminate the cockroach infestation.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully fumigated the kitchen, pretending to ward off imaginary pests.
meanings.sent4: Her determination fumigated her fears, allowing her to face challenges head-on.
meanings.sent5: The fumigated garden bloomed beautifully, free from destructive pests.

meanings.definition: To treat with fumes, as in order to disinfect or eradicate pests.
meanings.sent1: The hospital fumigated the room after the patient with a contagious illness left.
meanings.sent2: The zookeepers fumigated the animal enclosures to ensure the animals' health.
meanings.sent3: The detective fumigated the crime scene, searching for hidden clues in the air.
meanings.sent4: His words fumigated her heart, bringing warmth and comfort in difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The fumigated warehouse gleamed with cleanliness, free from any harmful pests.
